title: To those who think Hongkongers have won in this movement

replies.msg:
‪To those who think Hongkongers have won in this movement.

This is a TRAP. We have got nothing we asked for. ‬

There are 5 demands as the main theme of this movement, including:

1. Full withdrawal of the extradition bill
2. A commission of inquiry into alleged police brutality
3. Retracting the classification of protesters as “rioters”
4. Amnesty for arrested protesters
5. Dual universal suffrage for both the Legislative Council and
the Chief Executive

In this afternoon, our chief executive Carrie Lam announced that she would‪ propose the withdrawal of the bill in the legislative council. But the truth is that the legislative council is currently dominated by pro-Beijing camp. The motion will probably be voted down in October.

The fact is, we got nothing until now. ‬

5 demands not one less.
推畀外國睇
推比外國人

你估白宮無人mon?(The White House must monitor LIHKG)
https://lih.kg/1539378
- 分享自 LIHKG 討論區
Carrie Lam, LIAR
唔好畀佢地以為我地贏咗

Friends,
Today, the Hong Kong Leader Carrie Lam announced a formal withdrawal of the extradition bill amendment.
Some people believe this is a victory to the protesters. But I have to tell you that Hong Kong people have never literally “win” anything. We are still far from a relief.

In fact, a withdrawal of the bill amendment merely means the extradition bill is now “undone” to a level of what it has always been in the past 22 years. However, Hong Kong has already become a police state that is full of white terror in the past 80-ish days.

And in order to have Carrie Lam (HK government leader) to literally say “withdraw the bill,” we paid a very very heavy price.

We have two protestors (a teacher and a first aider) who lost their eye, more than six people committed suicide, over a thousand of people arrested... the youngest is just 13 years old. Many of the arrested are charged with riot crime. They could possibly face a sentence of 10-12 years.

Over the past two and a half months, the police force has been colluding with the triad gangs. Also, police officers are allowed to use all sort of unparalleled extreme violence, including weapons like pistol, expired tear gas, bean bag rounds, and rubber bullet to the protesters, journalists, and first aiders on site within a very short distance. This is already a total violation of safety protocol and human rights.

We also learned that some police officers tortured the arrested before an oral statement was taken. We have numerous cases of bone fractures, losing consciousness, sexual assaults reported during the period of suspect detention.

Under these circumstances, I believe the social movement is still far from an end. Instead, we afraid the gesture of “formally withdrawal” would serve as a delusion to the international community that the Hong Kong government has already fulfilled the protestors’ demand.

I hope to once again clearly state the four of the five demands here,

1. Establishment of an independent commission of inquiry into police conduct and use of force during the protests

2. Retraction of the "riot" characterisation

3. Release and exoneration of arrested protesters

4. Resignation of Carrie Lam and the implementation of universal suffrage for Legislative Council and Chief Executive elections

When Hong Kong people are still trying very very hard to fight for justice and freedom. I hope, I wish, and, if possible, I urge you to please stay with Hong Kong and support us in any way that you could think of. We need your help as we are now at a point of no return.
Please don’t trust Carrie Lam. It’s a trap!
唔好中計，dum上 Reddit dum上 Twitter
借 po reddit

Five Demands, Not One Less!
Too Little Too Late
push

To those who think HongKongers have won in this movement.

This is a TRAP. We have gotten nothing we asked for.

There are five demands as the main theme of this movement, including: -

1. Full withdrawal of the extradition bill;

2. A commission of inquiry into alleged police brutality;

3. Retracting the classification of protesters as “rioters”;

4. Amnesty for arrested protesters; and

5. Dual universal suffrage for both the Legislative Council and
the Chief Executive

This afternoon, our chief executive Carrie Lam announced that she would‪ PROPOSE the withdrawal of the bill in the legislative council. “Propose” being the operative word. The truth is our Legislative Council is currently dominated by pro-Beijing camp. The motion will likely be voted down in October when the Council resumes.

In fact, the government has not responded to a single demand of ours, as of today.

Police brutality has been inflicted upon the protestors as well as the general public. So far, simply due to actions taken by the police force:

- A girl has lost an eye;
- A boy has lost a leg;
- A few in critical condition fighting for their lives;
- 30+ were tortured in police custody; and

countless others act of violence.

It may have been enough in June, but after three months of being suppressed, the withdrawal of the bill is far from enough.

FIVE DEMANDS AND NOT ONE LESS.
None of our demands are met yet!
Up

the Chief Executive

In this afternoon, our chief executive Carrie Lam announced that she would‪ propose the withdrawal of the bill in the legislative council. But the truth is that the legislative council is currently dominated by pro-Beijing camp. The motion will probably be voted down in October.

replies.msg:
Evevn though the bill will be withdrawn in the LegCo in Oct., our other demands eg. investigations on excessive force used by the police has not been positively responsed yet.
CE Carrie Lam announced that there will be two more members getting into the Independent Police Complaints Council (IPCC), however, it is quickly found out that one of them was actually a member of Carrie Lam's election team, and another was the chairman of the Hong Kong Bar Association yet failed to stand up for the industry according to the news in 2018.
And the most notorious issue is that, the IPCC is actually composed of police themselves, which makes it almost impossible to prevent the conflict of interest. According to statistics, the percentage of successful appeals to cases about police's use of excessive force is 0.09%. How is that figure even presentable to say that the IPCC is independent as its name tells?
Therefore, we keep shouting all five demands, not one less... It's not merely a chant. Without an Independent Commission of Inquiry, we strongly and logically believe that the appeals will not be treated lawfully and rightfully.

quote.msg:
We don’t want peace,
we want justice

replies.msg: Peace could only be achieved IF the CE responded to our five demand, NOT ONE LESS.
